summary: This document contains multiple FAA Form 337 submissions detailing major repairs and alterations made to the Sikorsky S-76C helicopter (N722JE). The alterations include refurbishments of the aircraft's interior, installation of new equipment, and compliance with airworthiness standards. Various individuals and organizations are mentioned in relation to the work performed. This document appears to be a technical report related to the installation and testing of transponder systems in Sikorsky S-76C helicopters. It includes various installation instructions, compliance data, and test results for the transponder systems, but does not mention any individuals involved in the Epstein case. This document serves as a supplement to the Rotorcraft Flight Manual for the Sikorsky S-76C, detailing the installation and operational procedures for dual TDR-94D ATC/Mode-S/ADS-B transponders. It includes specifications for equipment, maintenance procedures, and compliance with FAA regulations. This document contains various FAA forms and reports related to the Sikorsky S-76C helicopter, including major repairs, alterations, and compliance statements. It details the modifications made to the aircraft, including installation of various systems and components, and outlines the necessary approvals and certifications required for these modifications. This document outlines the operating limitations and requirements for a Special Airworthiness Certificate issued for an experimental aircraft, specifically a Keystone Helicopter Corporation S-76C. It details the conditions under which the aircraft may be operated, including maintenance, inspection, and operational restrictions. This document includes various FAA forms related to the airworthiness certification of a helicopter, specifically the Sikorsky S76C with registration number N750A. It details inspections, certifications, and the aircraft's compliance with FAA regulations, indicating that it was found to be in a condition for safe operation.

events.title: Approval of Aircraft Modifications
events.description: Various modifications and repairs were completed on the Sikorsky S-76C helicopter, including interior refurbishments and equipment installations.

events.title: FAA Approval of Rotorcraft Flight Manual Supplement
events.description: The FAA approved the Rotorcraft Flight Manual Supplement for the Sikorsky S-76C detailing the installation of dual TDR-94D transponders.

events.title: Installation of Concorde Battery
events.description: The Concorde Battery was installed in the Sikorsky S-76C, with the weight and balance updated accordingly.

events.title: Special Airworthiness Certificate Issued
events.description: A Special Airworthiness Certificate was issued for the Sikorsky S-76C helicopter, allowing it to operate under specific limitations.

events.title: Installation of TrueNorth Avionics SATCOM System
events.description: Keystone Helicopter Corporation installed the TrueNorth Avionics SATCOM system with optional Wi-Fi on the Sikorsky S-76C helicopter.

events.title: Installation of Garmin GDL 69/69A System
events.description: Keystone Helicopter Corporation installed the Garmin GDL 69/69A system in accordance with STC# SR02424NY-D.

events.title: Production Flight Test
events.description: A production flight test was completed for the aircraft, determining it to be airworthy.

events.title: Issuance of Airworthiness Certificate
events.description: The FAA issued a standard airworthiness certificate for the aircraft after inspection.

keyFacts: The aircraft involved is a Sikorsky S-76C with registration N722JE.
Multiple alterations were made to the aircraft's interior, including reupholstering and fireblocking of seats.
Jane Biberstein conducted flammability tests on materials used in the aircraft's interior.
The document includes multiple FAA Form 337 submissions for compliance with airworthiness standards.
The work was performed by various certified individuals and organizations, ensuring adherence to FAA regulations.
The document contains technical specifications and installation instructions for Rockwell Collins transponder systems.
It references multiple installation and compliance reports related to Sikorsky helicopters.
No named individuals are mentioned in this document.
The document outlines the installation and operational procedures for dual TDR-94D ATC/Mode-S/ADS-B transponders in the Sikorsky S-76C.
Mark D. Haycock is the Flight Analyst who approved the FAA Form 8110-3 for the transponder installation.
John Driscoll submitted the FAA Form 337 for the aircraft registration N722JE.
The Concorde Battery was installed as part of the aircraft's maintenance, with a weight increase of 3 lbs.
The document includes compliance with FAA regulations and maintenance procedures for the transponder systems.
The Sikorsky S-76C helicopter is registered under N750A.
Keystone Helicopter Corporation performed multiple modifications and installations on the helicopter.
Various FAA forms and compliance statements are included, detailing the alterations made to the aircraft.
The document outlines the operating limitations and requirements for the helicopter's operation.
The document is subject to a protective order, limiting its dissemination.
The aircraft is a Keystone Helicopter Corporation S-76C with registration number N750A.
The Special Airworthiness Certificate was issued on January 14, 2010, and is valid until February 13, 2010.
The aircraft is restricted to research and development purposes only.
The pilot-in-command must hold appropriate ratings and notify air traffic control of the aircraft's experimental nature.
The aircraft must not be operated over densely populated areas or for compensation or hire.
The aircraft in question is a Sikorsky S76C with registration number N750A.
The airworthiness certificate was issued on December 8, 2008.
The aircraft was found to be in a condition for safe operation after inspections.
The production flight test was completed on December 3, 2008, with a total flight time of 3.2 hours.
The document includes multiple FAA forms related to the aircraft's certification process.
